New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first major league player with at least 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Ohtani broke the Dodgersâ€™ franchise record of 49 homers set by Shawn Green in 2001.
Ohtani reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game, faster than any other player in major league history.
Key Match Events: Ohtani hit three home runs and stole two bases in a game.
He hit his 50th home run in the seventh inning, an opposite-field, two-run shot to left against Marlins reliever Mike Baumann.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was highly anticipated due to Ohtani's history-making performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Miguel Rojas expressed emotions about witnessing Ohtani's performance.
Ohtani himself expressed surprise about his performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game, faster than any other player in major league history.
Ohtani's performance secured a playoff spot for the Dodgers.
Others: The game was a 20-4 rout of the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani finished 6 for 6 with 10 RBIs in the game.
